page.title: 01Moorland 4 Mile S Of Loftus
page.content: A barren area of moorland & heath edged in th east by some farmland and to the north a reservoir called Scaling Dam. Which covers 15 acres. The area is rolling moorland at a height of 250 metres and is extensively grazed by sheep. The area is mostly covered by heather and wet bogland crossed by tracks & sheep paths with only two metaled roads. Part of the National Park. No amenities except for a passing bus service and a seasonal public house plus a picnic site at the eastern edge of the dam.
